body.p: The enclosed is Stedman's letter ab't the "Complete" I tho't you m't like to read—(T B Aldrich's also tho' short is very friendly & eulogistic—not sent here)—

Nothing in my condition &c specially notable—but the pegs are gradually loosening, perhaps being slowly pull'd out—I have been kept in here now almost a year, (not been out doors once in that time—hardly out of the sick room)—but as before said I get along more comfortably than you might suppose—had lots of Doctors but they have all vanished—fair nights & tolerable days—Am busying myself with a new ed'n of L of G. with "Sands at 70" and "Backward Glance" all in one Vol. bound (in thinner paper) in pocket-book style, I have had a notion for, & now put out partly to occupy myself, & partly to commemorate finishing my 70th year—

Sit up mainly all day—at present (as so often told) in my big arm chair with the thick wolf skin spread on the back—writing this on the tablet on my lap—early afternoon—fairly comfortable—a good oak fire—raw & dark weather out—Love & good prospects to all—

postscript.p: Kennedy please send all to Mrs O'Connor
& O'C please send on to Dr Bucke
